com.samskivert.net.cddb
Class CDDB

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.net.cddb.CDDB

public class CDDB
extends Object

The CDDB class provides access to the information provided by servers compliant with the CDDB protocol.

Nested Class Summary
static class CDDB.Detail
          A detail object contains all of the detailed information about a particular CD as retrieved from the CDDB server.
static class CDDB.Entry
          This class encapsulates the information needed to look up a full CDDB record for a particular disc.
 
Field Summary
static String CLIENT_NAME
          The client name reported to the CDDB server.
static String CLIENT_VERSION
          The client version reported to the CDDB server.
static int STANDARD_PORT
          The port on which CDDB servers are generally run.
 
Constructor Summary
CDDB()

          Connects this CDDB instance to the CDDB server running on the supplied host using the specified port.

Constructor Detail

CDDB

public CDDB()
Method Detail

connect

public String connect(String hostname)
               throws IOException,
                      CDDBException
Connects this CDDB instance to the CDDB server running on the supplied host using the standard port.

Note well: you must close a CDDB connection once you are done with it, otherwise the socket connection will remain open and pointlessly consume machine resources.

Parameters:
hostname - The host to which to connect.
Returns:
The message supplied with the succesful connection response.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if a network error occurs attempting to connect to the host.
CDDBException - Thrown if an error occurs after identifying ourselves to the host.
See Also:
STANDARD_PORT, close()

connect

public String connect(String hostname,
                      int port)
               throws IOException,
                      CDDBException
Connects this CDDB instance to the CDDB server running on the supplied host using the specified port.

Note well: you must close a CDDB connection once you are done with it, otherwise the socket connection will remain open and pointlessly consume machine resources.

Parameters:
hostname - The host to which to connect.
port - The port number on which to connect to the host.
Returns:
The message supplied with the succesful connection response.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if a network error occurs attempting to connect to the host.
CDDBException - Thrown if an error occurs after identifying ourselves to the host.
See Also:
close()

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws SocketException
Specifies the number of milliseconds that the client should wait for a response from the server before aborting. This must be called after a successful call to connect, otherwise the timeout will not be set.

Throws:
SocketException

connected

public boolean connected()
Returns:
true if this CDDB instance is connected to a CDDB server.

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes the connection to the CDDB server previously opened with a call to connect(java.lang.String). If the connection was not previously established, this member function does nothing.

Throws:
IOException

query

public CDDB.Entry[] query(String discid,
                          int[] frameOffsets,
                          int length)
                   throws IOException,
                          CDDBException
Issues a query to the CDDB server using the supplied CD identifying information.

Parameters:
discid - The disc identifier (information on how to compute the disc ID is available here.
frameOffsets - The frame offset of each track. The length of this array is assumed to be the number of tracks on the CD and is used in the query.
length - The length (in seconds) of the CD.
Returns:
If no entry matches the query, null is returned. Otherwise one or more entries is returned that matched the query parameters.
Throws:
IOException
CDDBException

read

public CDDB.Detail read(String category,
                        String discid)
                 throws IOException,
                        CDDBException
Requests the detail information for a particular disc in a particular category from the CDDB server.

Returns:
A detail instance filled with the information for the requested CD.
Throws:
IOException
CDDBException
